name: No annulment solely on confessions
text: §580-29  No annulment solely on confessions.  No sentence of nullity of marriage shall be pronounced solely on the declarations or confessions of the parties.  The court shall, in all cases, require other satisfactory evidence of the facts on which the allegation of nullity is founded. [CC 1859, §1322; am L 1903, c 22, §2; RL 1925, §2964; RL 1935, §4459; RL 1945, §12209; RL 1955, §324-9; HRS §580-29; am L 1973, c 211, §5(n)]
